trial_identification.studytitle: The 2-hour effects of whole-grain wheat in women with overweight or obesity
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effects of whole-grain wheat on postprandial biological markers in Australian women at risk of metabolic dysfunction: a randomised cross-over trial

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other inflammatory or immune system disorders

interventions.interventions: Following an overnight fast, on two separate occasions separated by a one-week washout, one of two randomised interventions will be served, comprising whole-grain wheat ready-to-eat breakfast cereal prepared by either regular or additional processing methods, with low fat milk, standardised to 50g available carbohydrate (approximately 4 biscuits and 300 ml milk).
interventions.comparator: Whole-grain wheat ready-to-eat breakfast cereal (regular processing).

primaryOutcome.outcome: Postprandial metabolic dysfunction measured by peripheral biological markers of oxidative stress and glycaemic parameters.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At 0 time and every 30 minutes to 120 minutes postprandially.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Postprandial immune dysfunction measured by peripheral biological markers of inflammation.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At 0 time and every 30 minutes to 120 minutes postprandially.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Female Overweight or obesity by waist circumference >80 cm or BMI > 25-35 kg/m2 Age 30-60 years
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Participants with an allergy to wheat, gluten, dairy or lactose. Pregnancy or lactation. Smoking. Liver, kidney or heart disease. Type 1 diabetes and type 2 diabetes with insulin medication. The use of any medication for weight loss. Participants that do not regularly consume breakfast. Unable to participate for 4-week period, including preliminary information visit and wash-out period. Excessive exercisers, participating in regular physical activity in excess of moderate intensity and duration. Participants with obesity caused by genetic factors or medication. Neurological, endocrinological or other major systemic disease, including malignancy. Acute illness or current evidence of acute or chronic inflammatory or infective disease; treatment for anaemia within the past 3 months; cirrhosis or chronic hepatitis.

trial_design.concealment: Participants will be enrolled by answering advertisements about the trial, considering the Information to Participants" form, followed by medical and eligibility criteria screening. Once the participant has provided informed consent, allocation concealment will be achieved using sealed opaque envelopes.
trial_design.statisticalmethods: Quantitative data will be entered into and analysed by statistical applications using Microsoft Exel and IBM SPSS Statistics (V.19) with the assistance of a statistician where required. Descriptive statistics will include mean, standard deviation or standard error of the mean for all anthropometric and biochemical data collected and analysed for significance using the statistical software.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim of this study is to measure the acute (2-hour) effects following consumption of wheat whole-grain foods differing in processing treatment on obesity-related measures. This study hypothesises that the grain products that have undergone selected additional processing will contain greater nutrients and bioactive compounds and have favourable outcomes on postprandial measures compared with regular whole-grain products.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Victoria University Human Research Ethics Committee
